doc-meta.title: Pfizer 'all in' on advancing next-generation pneumococcal vaccine candidate: CFO

section.text: The race is on for a next-generation pneumococcal vaccine. Merck has already pushed its 15-valent candidate into phase 3, and on Thursday, Pfizer CFO Frank D’Amelio said his company is “all in” on reaching the market as soon as possible with its candidate.

doc-meta.title: News of Note—GlaxoSmithKline, Ebola and SK Bioscience

section.text: Here is some other vaccine news of note for the week. > GlaxoSmithKline has reported £1.25 billion ($1.65 billion) in second-quarter vaccine sales, a 16% increase at constant currencies. Reuters story > The World Health Organization has declared an end to the Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo. Release Free Daily NewsletterLike this story? doc-meta.title: News of Note—Pfizer results, GSK shortage and more

section.text: Here is some other vaccine news of note for the week: > Pfizer's vaccine sales in the third quarter grew 12% to $1.85 billion. Prevnar 13 sales in the U.S. were up 12% due to the timing of government purchases. Release (PDF) > Pharmacists in Canada are reporting a shortage of GlaxoSmithKline's hep A and B vaccine for travelers Twinrix. CBC article Free Daily NewsletterLike this story? Release > Enesi Pharma entered an R&D deal to work on vaccines against Chikungunya, Zika and peanut allergy. Release
